thread.title: Half of Little Mix took Premier League footballers to the BRIT Awards as dates
thread.title_full: Half of Little Mix took Premier League footballers to the BRIT Awards as dates

author: Richard Innes
title: Half of Little Mix took Premier League footballers to the BRIT Awards as dates
text:
Sport Half of Little Mix took Premier League footballers to the BRIT Awards as dates Two top footballers had to play second fiddle as they sat and watched their girlfriends pick up up silverware Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Premier League stars support their little mix dates at the Brits Share this video Get daily     
There is a long and glorious history of footballers dating pop stars. 
Now, thanks to Little Mix's table at the BRIT Awards , it seems there are not one, but two couples attempting to follow in the footsteps of David and Victoria Beckham. 
Little Mix won their first ever Brit at the glitzy do, when they were named the winners of Best British Single. As you can see in the clip above, when the camera panned over to their table at the moment their win was announced, the focus was understandably on the very excited members of the group. Little Mix at the BRIT Awards (Photo: Rex Features) 
However, eagle-eyed viewers (those who are fans of football, anyway), may have noticed the two men sitting either side of the four band members. 
…and Burnley's Andre Gray. (Photo: Jan Kruger) 
Oxlade-Chamberlain has been dating Perrie Edwards since November, while Gray reportedly got together with Leigh-Anne Pinnock in January. Perrie Edwards and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Photo: Splash News/WENN) 
And sure enough, the two Premier League stars were sat next to their respective girlfriends at the awards ceremony. 
Take another look at the video and you will see how, immediately after finding out they had won a BRIT, Perrie leaned in for a kiss with the Arsenal midfielder… 
…before Leigh-Anne did the same thing with the Burnley striker… 
…leaving the two footballers to sit and watch as their dates picked up the silverware. 
Gunners midfielder Oxlade-Chamberlain was taking advantage of Arsenal's ten day break between fixtures, after playing in both the Champions League hammering at Bayern Munich and the FA Cup win at Sutton. 
Speaking after the Sutton victory, Oxlade-Chamberlain said: “I think the only thing you can do after a really disappointing result is to get a win. We did that, we came here, we had a job to do and we did the job. We’re into the next round of the cup, that’s all that matters. (Photo: PA) (Photo: REUTERS) 
“It’s good to get back to winning ways against any team, even if they are a good few leagues below you and I’m glad we did that. We’ve got a little break now before our next game, we needed that win and we can focus again on the league.” 
Oxlade-Chamberlain also revealed the Sutton tie was the most fun he has had all season and claimed players like Alexis Sanchez will never have experienced that sort of night before. 
They now face another non-league opponent in the next round and Oxlade-Chamberlain insists they will not be pushovers after their win at Burnley. 
Oxlade-Chamberlain added: “It wasn’t the normal experience but I grew up in League One, I’m used to these places and having that experience that was one of the most exciting times I’ve had this season. 
“Coming off the bus, both sets of supporters in close proximity and it was a really good experience, I really enjoyed it. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
